verses.verse: Now Jethro <S%H3503><s%>, the priest <S%H3548><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%>, Moses <S%H4872><s%>' father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law, heard <S%H8085><s%> of all that God <S%H430><s%> had done <S%H6213><s%> for Moses <S%H4872><s%>, and for Israel <S%H3478><s%> his people <S%H5971><s%>, how that Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> had brought <S%H3318><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> out of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.

And Jethro <S%H3503><s%>, Moses <S%H4872><s%>' father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law, took <S%H3947><s%> Zipporah <S%H6855><s%>, Moses <S%H4872><s%>' wife <S%H802><s%>, after <S%H310><s%> he had sent her away <S%H7964><s%>,

and her two <S%H8147><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%>; of whom the name <S%H8034><s%> of the one <S%H259><s%> was Gershom <S%H1647><s%>; for he said <S%H559><s%>, I have been a sojourner <S%H1616><s%> in a foreign <S%H5237><s%> land <S%H776><s%>:

and the name <S%H8034><s%> of the other <S%H259><s%> was Eliezer <S%H461><s%>; for he said <S%H430><s%>, The God of my father <S%H1><s%> was my help <S%H5828><s%>, and delivered <S%H5337><s%> me from the sword <S%H2719><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>.

And Jethro <S%H3503><s%>, Moses <S%H4872><s%>' father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law, came <S%H935><s%> with his sons <S%H1121><s%> and his wife <S%H802><s%> unto Moses <S%H4872><s%> into the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> where he was encamped <S%H2583><s%>, at the mount <S%H2022><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>:

and he said <S%H559><s%> unto Moses <S%H4872><s%>, I <S%H2859><s%>, thy father-in-law Jethro <S%H3503><s%>, am come <S%H935><s%> unto thee <S%H802><s%>, and thy wife, and her two <S%H8147><s%> sons with her <S%H1121><s%>.

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%> to meet <S%H7125><s%> his father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law, and did obeisance <S%H7812><s%>, and kissed <S%H5401><s%> him <S%H7592><s%>; and they asked each <S%H376><s%> other <S%H7453><s%> of their welfare <S%H7965><s%>; and they came <S%H935><s%> into the tent <S%H168><s%>.

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> told <S%H5608><s%> his father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law all that Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> had done <S%H6213><s%> unto Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> and to the Egyptians <S%H4714><s%> for Israel <S%H3478><s%>'s sake <S%H182><s%>, all the travail <S%H8513><s%> that had come <S%H4672><s%> upon them by the way <S%H1870><s%>, and how Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> delivered them <S%H5337><s%>.

And Jethro <S%H3503><s%> rejoiced <S%H2302><s%> for all the goodness <S%H2896><s%> which Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> had done <S%H6213><s%> to Israel <S%H3478><s%>, in that he had delivered <S%H5337><s%> them out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the Egyptians <S%H4714><s%>.

And Jethro <S%H3503><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Blessed <S%H1288><s%> be Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, who hath delivered <S%H5337><s%> you out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the Egyptians <S%H4714><s%>, and out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>; who hath delivered <S%H5337><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> from under the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the Egyptians <S%H4714><s%>.
Now I know <S%H3045><s%> that Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> is greater <S%H1419><s%> than all gods <S%H430><s%>; yea <S%H1697><s%>, in the thing wherein they dealt proudly against them <S%H2102><s%>.

And Jethro <S%H3503><s%>, Moses <S%H4872><s%>' father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law, took <S%H3947><s%> a burnt-offering <S%H5930><s%> and sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> for God <S%H430><s%>: and Aaron <S%H175><s%> came <S%H935><s%>, and all the elders <S%H2205><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, to eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> with Moses <S%H4872><s%>' father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law before <S%H6440><s%> God <S%H430><s%>.

And it came to pass on the morrow <S%H4283><s%>, that Moses <S%H4872><s%> sat <S%H3427><s%> to judge <S%H8199><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%>: and the people <S%H5971><s%> stood <S%H5975><s%> about Moses <S%H4872><s%> from the morning <S%H1242><s%> unto the evening <S%H6153><s%>.

And when Moses <S%H4872><s%>' father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law saw <S%H7200><s%> all that he did <S%H6213><s%> to the people <S%H5971><s%>, he said <S%H559><s%>, What is this thing <S%H1697><s%> that thou doest <S%H6213><s%> to the people <S%H5971><s%>? why sittest <S%H3427><s%> thou thyself alone <S%H5971><s%>, and all the people stand <S%H5324><s%> about thee from morning <S%H1242><s%> unto even <S%H6153><s%>?
And Moses <S%H4872><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto his father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law, Because the people <S%H5971><s%> come <S%H935><s%> unto me to inquire <S%H1875><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>:

when they have a matter <S%H1697><s%>, they come <S%H935><s%> unto me <S%H8199><s%>; and I judge between a man <S%H376><s%> and his neighbor <S%H7453><s%>, and I make them know <S%H3045><s%> the statutes <S%H2706><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>, and his laws <S%H8451><s%>.
And Moses <S%H4872><s%>' father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H1697><s%>, The thing that thou doest <S%H6213><s%> is not good <S%H2896><s%>.

Thou wilt surely <S%H5034><s%> wear away <S%H5034><s%>, both thou <S%H5971><s%>, and this people that is with thee <S%H1697><s%>: for the thing is too heavy <S%H3515><s%> for thee <S%H3201><s%>; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone <S%H6213><s%>.

Hearken <S%H8085><s%> now unto my voice <S%H6963><s%>, I will give thee counsel <S%H3289><s%>, and God <S%H430><s%> be <S%H1961><s%> with thee <S%H5971><s%>: be thou for the people to Godward <S%H4136><s%>, and bring <S%H935><s%> thou the causes <S%H1697><s%> unto God <S%H430><s%>:

and thou shalt teach <S%H2094><s%> them the statutes <S%H2706><s%> and the laws <S%H8451><s%>, and shalt show <S%H3045><s%> them the way <S%H1870><s%> wherein they must walk <S%H3212><s%>, and the work <S%H4639><s%> that they must do <S%H6213><s%>.

Moreover thou shalt provide <S%H2372><s%> out of all the people <S%H5971><s%> able <S%H2428><s%> men <S%H582><s%>, such as fear <S%H3373><s%> God <S%H430><s%>, men <S%H582><s%> of truth <S%H571><s%>, hating <S%H8130><s%> unjust gain <S%H1215><s%>; and place <S%H7760><s%> such over them <S%H8269><s%>, to be rulers of thousands <S%H505><s%>, rulers <S%H8269><s%> of hundreds <S%H3967><s%>, rulers <S%H8269><s%> of fifties <S%H2572><s%>, and rulers <S%H8269><s%> of tens <S%H6235><s%>:

and let them judge <S%H8199><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> at all seasons <S%H6256><s%>: and it shall be <S%H1419><s%>, that every great matter <S%H1697><s%> they shall bring <S%H935><s%> unto thee <S%H6996><s%>, but every small matter <S%H1697><s%> they shall judge <S%H8199><s%> themselves <S%H7043><s%>: so shall it be easier for thyself <S%H5375><s%>, and they shall bear the burden with thee.

If thou shalt do <S%H6213><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%>, and God <S%H430><s%> command <S%H6680><s%> thee so <S%H3201><s%>, then thou shalt be able to endure <S%H5975><s%>, and all this people <S%H5971><s%> also shall go <S%H935><s%> to their place <S%H4725><s%> in peace <S%H7965><s%>.
So Moses <S%H4872><s%> hearkened <S%H8085><s%> to the voice <S%H6963><s%> of his father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law, and did <S%H6213><s%> all that he had said <S%H559><s%>.

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> chose <S%H977><s%> able <S%H2428><s%> men <S%H582><s%> out of all Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and made <S%H5414><s%> them heads <S%H7218><s%> over the people <S%H5971><s%>, rulers <S%H8269><s%> of thousands <S%H505><s%>, rulers <S%H8269><s%> of hundreds <S%H3967><s%>, rulers <S%H8269><s%> of fifties <S%H2572><s%>, and rulers <S%H8269><s%> of tens <S%H6235><s%>.

And they judged <S%H8199><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> at all seasons <S%H6256><s%>: the hard <S%H7186><s%> causes <S%H1697><s%> they brought <S%H935><s%> unto Moses <S%H4872><s%>, but every small <S%H6996><s%> matter <S%H1697><s%> they judged themselves <S%H8199><s%>.
And Moses <S%H4872><s%> let his father-in <S%H2859><s%>-law depart <S%H7971><s%>; and he went <S%H3212><s%> his way into his own land <S%H776><s%>.
